projects.title: Trivial File Transfer Protocol
projects.desc: This Java program is a TFTP implementation that acts similar to a TCP handshake, which allows packets to be sent from one computer to another. Acknowledgement packets ensures that each packet was sent successfully

projects.title: Email Signature
projects.desc: A client from Upwork requested an email signature and provided assets and a general layout. I sent prototypes of the signature to the client and made changes accordingly

projects.title: Message Board
projects.desc: A full stack (MERN) site using Express/Node to create a REST API in order to communicate with the MongoDB database. This allows users to register an account, create new messages, and view other people's messages. It's currently a local host project and a minimum viable product.

projects.title: Project Management System
projects.desc: This Spring project relies heavily on mocking agile development to mimic what working on projects would be like. I created features on new branches and any new features required a pull request to be merged onto the production branch.  Every new feature required unit tests as a bare minimum. I conducted biweekly stand-ups to view the project's status and to consider future features

projects.title: No Shot Card Game
projects.desc: First project created in Go. Created based off of 'Red Flags', a card game in which you create an ideal date and someone trys to ruin the date with a flaw. Initally created poorly, and wasn't testable, then I refactored the code and used TDD as much as possible to recreate this project with solid unit tests.
